message.body: morning sir
Good Morning
Did you get my VM?
I did. that sounds fine
I was actually going to see if you wanted to come by before that. Im putting the trim up around my door and thought you might be interested in working with a compressor
Well, I got to run an errand in a little bit, so if I get done that in time, I might be able to swing by early
What's wrong with your compressor?
I mean, I have worked with a compressor before with a nail gun. Freaking thigns weigh like 60 pounds lol
oh, ok. yeah theres nothing wrong with it, just wasnt sure if you used one before
It's been a few years
theres not much to it really
Yeah, it's a very useful device
main thing is not shooting yourself with a nail
haha, yes, that sucks
Not that I've done that yet
I've seen the aftermaths
I figure it'll probably be rather difficult to frame that door by yourself
Lately Ive been trying to find things I can do for income. Im not looking for a real job but do need to make some $ to pay bills
trying to hold the pieces and hitting it with nails
Yes, agreed
oh thats not hard, but if your around I could always use a hand
There are some options out that
Substitute teaching
They always need subs
and you don't need a degree
hmm, don't know if I see myself doing that
maybe for like shop class or something
yeah, it's tough
Well, they don't need those subs too bad, but the votech office will add you to the sub list
I'm on there
Haven't heard from them for two years, but of course I don't specialize
hows the pay work?
Pretty bad
12/hr for normal classes, I guess shop class might be higher
Im kind of looking for something a little more steady and higher pay. Having a business lic. helps out in some ways, they you can find contract work
Another idea is this one website, I forget the name, but you put people up for the night like a bed and breakfast and they pay you like 20 bucks
thats kind of cool, but still not much
Yeah, I think contract work will be the highest pay to be had
Are you having any luck with that?
and its not like im trying to get rich, its just the best return on the time invested
My friend's dad may need a guy off and on, he pays pretty good for guys that are autonomous
Ive seen a few things. One is rerunning cable drops to customers homes in MA for $28 per drop
how long does a drop take?
it depends. an easy one might take 20-30 minutes. a difficult one could take slightly over an hour
just sucks its in MA, its a 6 hour drive but they give you $50/day for lodging
That's awesome and just couchsurf
or pay like 20 bucks a night at that one website
Have you heard of Couchsurfing.org?
Or you can do a houseswap
yeah, Im on there
oh cool
yeah I dont know about all that just need a temp place to stay while working. Thing is when you go out of town for a gig like that you typically work a lot
stay a week or so then come home
yeah
it doesn't allow you much time to get to know the local area
which may offend some CSers
well you still have the evenings
Oh, well then that would be fine for most people
you dont want to be out there running drops in the dark
right
thats one of the perks is you get to travel
Im going to look into it. I could probably use a hand if youre interested
ideally what im looking for is something more local and reaccuring
yeah, I'm interested
would be nice if I could get another ladder, assuming your not afraid of heights
with two ladders we could do some serious damage rerunning drops. maybe like 15-20 a day
I am more cautious with heights then most people, but I just go up the ladder a little slower then others
yeah it just takes getting used to. ive been working on them for years and have never had a problem
and I don't take as many chances, so yeah a little afraid of heights, but that shouldn't be too bad as I get more used to being up high.
Most of the jobs I've done have been indoors on ladders that much bigger then 10 feet
most of the time your not more than 20 ft off the ground
So, outside is just kind of newish to me
drops usually have to be about 14-15
feet off the ground so trucks wont knock them down
ahhh
but if theres no road then it doesnt need to be more than 9 or 10
yeah, I don't see it as being a problem, but maybe I aught to check before I ride up to MA with ya
I have an aluminum ladder, not sure how big it is, maybe 15 feet fully extended
I might have another one
let me go cheak
check*
seeing how I only have one ladder I would be the one on it anyway. It would be nice to have a shorter ladder to use on house
oh, ive got a friend I could borrow from probably
We've got a wooden one that extends to about 20 feet I think
It's a little buried in our garage though
I emailed them so hopefully they will get back to me
as far as this weekend Im waiting to hear back from my cousin. We would be leaving on sunday
Oh, okay, cool
I'm going to leave in a few minutes and will meet you at your place by 12ish
ok, ill see ya then
k, cya
